subject: AI
title: Few-Shot Examples
description: Show the model what you want by giving it examples.

hook.text: You need the model to extract product names from messy support emails. Zero-shot gets it half right. You add three examples and accuracy jumps to 95%.

buildup.text: Few-shot prompting means including 2‚Äì5 input-output examples in your prompt before the actual task. The model mimics the pattern it sees.

discovery.text: The examples don't teach the model new knowledge ‚Äî they demonstrate the format, style, and logic you expect. Think of them as a visual spec.

twist.text: Bad examples poison the output. If your examples have inconsistent formatting or edge-case errors, the model faithfully reproduces those errors.

climax.text: Pick diverse, clean examples that cover typical and edge cases. Three good examples beat ten sloppy ones.

punchline.text: Don't describe the pattern. Show it. Models learn by example, literally.

quiz.question: What do few-shot examples primarily demonstrate to the model?
options: The expected format, style, and logic of the output
